name: N-methyl-2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2481
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base melting point is around 106°C. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point. The phenyl group introduces additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20 °C for each phenyl group. The methoxy group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 °C. The ether linkage introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +2 °C. The dioxane-like bridging moiety introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +5 °C.
